places_with_reviews.name: Tiger Falls
places_with_reviews.address: Kanaser Range, Chakrata, Kanaser Range, Uttarakhand 248123, India

reviews.text: Tiger Waterfall in Uttarakhand is a hidden gem waiting to be discovered by adventure seekers. After a scenic trek of over a kilometer, visitors are rewarded with the sight of this majestic waterfall cascading from a height of 50 meters. The journey to reach the waterfall adds to the excitement, with lush greenery and refreshing streams along the way. Once there, tourists can't help but marvel at the sheer beauty and power of the waterfall, making it a memorable experience for all who visit. If you're in Uttarakhand and craving a dose of nature's splendor, Tiger Waterfall is a must-see destination.

I always dreamt to visit such place without crowd & I still can't believe that the dream came true. There was even not single person except me & my friends. We enjoyed the waterfall & the nature in the lap of the Jungle.
Chirping of little birds🐦 & soft sound of falling water made our trip to Chakarata worth. It is an another one of awesome memories in the mind not only the photo in call call phone📱 & camera📸.
There are many good options to stay near the waterfall in circle of 100m to several KMs.
We visited in middle of April 24, & the weather was little warm in day & chilled in the  night. We recommend people to visit this place with friends & family but with a special note, remember that do not spread leftovers, don't make the place dirty & help keep the nature & the environment neat & clean.

Had an amazing time at the Tiger Falls( Largest Direct Falling Waterfall in India ). The roar of the falls is truly the exciting part as it falls from over hundreds of feet high.  If you’re Lucky you would see Rainbows forming nearby adding to the beauty of the place.
Make Sure to go in an off season or when it’s less crowded as it spoils the Fun and experience to Relax peacefully. Sit on the rocks nearby and experience the beauty of nature🦋

Fall is really beautiful and height is around 30-40 feet. Nearly 90km from Dehradoon. Roads were good and crowd was decent. You can either go with diwn hiking or can go in your car. Limited parking facility with first come first serve. Food options were there too like Maggie, omelette, sandwich etc. You can take bath in the fall.

Waterfall is stunning, but it's quite far from Chakrata Hill Station, making it more of a one-time trip because of the distance. Plus, if you're used to hills, it might not be as exciting since there's nothing else around besides the waterfall.

places_with_reviews.name: Chirmiri Peak/Top

reviews.text: Chirmiri Peak top in Uttarakhand offers a breathtaking sunset experience that's truly unforgettable. As the highest peak in the area, it provides panoramic views of the surrounding hills and valleys, creating a picturesque setting for nature lovers and photographers alike. Tourists flock here to witness the mesmerizing colors of the sunset painting the sky, making it a must-visit destination for anyone exploring Uttarakhand's natural wonders.

The best Sunset Experience I’ve ever had!! The silence of the place and gushing sounds of Tibetan Flags make it a mesmerising experience.

Just this place needs a little cleaning and maintenance.
Carry your Tea/Coffee and Snacks with you and enjoy the Vibe.

Don't miss this if you are visiting Chakrata, nice place ot be with yourself, timed it well so that you can enjoy sunset or sunrise, avoid afternoon. The wind is very strong and it is bit colder than the town area, so come prepared. No shops, no water vendor, please carry them. At least water is must, you wil have to walk uphills for about 300 meters to reach the place and in summer the first thing you will look for after reaching the top is water. I have experienced the Sun set and it was awesome.

This place has to be the highlight of Chakrata with gorgeous sunrise and an even amazing sunset. There's an open field about 150m long good enough for picnic/spending time together. Cows graze during the day.

Chirmiri Peak top (also known as Sunset Point) is a great place for photography. However, you need to carry water bottle or snacks with you as there are no Shop within 3 KM area. This is not a Crowded place.

places_with_reviews.name: Sunset point
places_with_reviews.address: MVPF+J88, Vikasnagar - Chakrata Rd, Kaliana, Uttarakhand 248123, India

reviews.text: The sunset point near Tiger Falls in Chakrata, Uttarakhand, is an unparalleled experience. The Moila viewpoint offers a picturesque setting for witnessing nature's dance, with swirling clouds and snow-capped mountains painting a breathtaking scene, particularly in January and February. Throughout the year, the mesmerizing views of the mountains and captivating sunsets create unforgettable moments. A must-visit destination for those seeking serene beauty and natural wonder.

Genuine review by Mr.e

In Chakrata , you need to have your own vehicle 'coz you won't find any public transport , however this place is the perfect for sunset and offers the best view in Chakrata, there are no shops around , so come here watch sunset and leave for your next place, parking is not a problem here, its an open area
This is a beautiful place in Chakrata. Although I couldn't witness the sunset or sunrise but the sheer beauty of this place is breathtaking. It was pleasant, calm and simply beautiful.
Beautiful place❤️❤️you can spend few hours in morning or in evening here...

Best place for camping and picnic, amazing view of the Himalayas and Sunset.
But people from Haryana and Delhi come here to drink alcohol. Authorities should give more attention to this and alcohol shouldn't be allowed here.
Also, my humble request to fellow travelers & tourists. PLEASE DO NOT LITTER HERE & THERE. KEEP THESE TOURISTS SIGHTS CLEAN FOR OUR FUTURE GENERATIONS.

BE A RESPONSIBLE TOURSIT.

places_with_reviews.name: Lower Sunset Point Chirmiri

reviews.text: Visiting the sunset point in Chakrata, Uttarakhand is an absolute must for nature lovers. Located around 7-8 hours from Delhi by car, this tranquil spot offers breathtaking views, serene surroundings, and a peaceful atmosphere. With only a few locals residing in the area, you can truly immerse yourself in the natural beauty and enjoy the soothing weather while witnessing a mesmerizing sunset."
What a fantastic location, the temperature dipped to 9 degrees at the end of April, quite 🥶

Awesome and attractive place to watch sunset without giving too much efforts to your legs. You have to take a U turn(if coming from vikasnagar side) from toll naka chakrata and then keep driving for 5-6 kms. Then you will reach your beautiful destination.
Nice place, picturesque view
Cool and peaceful place.

This place is almost 4hrs drive from Chakrata because of uphill drive it will take time.. very scenic beauty around the temple..will visit again sometime.
Temple doors close at 4pm sharp for Puja and then reopen in 45mins but darshan can be done only after 6pm because of the evening Puja at mandir. Temple has ample amount of parking space.
